content:
Your task is to create a concise running summary of actions and information results in the provided text, focusing on key and potentially important information to remember.

You will receive the current summary and your latest actions. Combine them, adding relevant key information from the latest development in 1st person past tense and keeping the summary concise.

Summary So Far:
"""
I received a message to execute the "execute_shell_popen" command to check the status of the "arcgis" module, which returned a subprocess with PID: '3664'. The module is installed. I also received a message to execute the python code to generate the river map, which includes adding the path to the 'arcgis' module and connecting to ArcGIS Online. The code adds a feature layer to the map and saves it as a web map with the title "River Map" and snippet "A map of rivers in the USA".
"""

Latest Development:
"""
[Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "execute_shell_popen", "args": {"command_line": "pip install -U arcgis"}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content="Command execute_shell_popen returned: Subprocess started with PID:'3567'", type='action_result'), Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "execute_python_code", "args": {"code": "#!/usr/bin/env python\\n\\nimport sys\\n\\n# Add the path to the \'arcgis\' module\\nsys.path.append(\'/usr/local/lib/python3.9/site-packages\')\\n\\nfrom arcgis.gis import GIS\\nfrom arcgis.mapping import WebMap\\n\\n# Connect to ArcGIS Online\\ngis = GIS(\\"https://www.arcgis.com\\", \\"username\\", \\"password\\")\\n\\n# Create a new web map\\nweb_map = WebMap()\\n\\n# Add a feature layer to the map\\nweb_map.add_layer({\\"type\\": \\"FeatureLayer\\", \\"url\\": \\"https://services.arcgis.com/V6ZHFr6zdgNZuVG0/arcgis/rest/services/USA_Rivers_and_Streams/FeatureServer/0\\"})\\n\\n# Save the web map\\nweb_map.save(item_properties={\\"title\\": \\"River Map\\", \\"snippet\\": \\"A map of rivers in the USA\\"})", "basename": "generate_river_map"}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "execute_shell_popen", "args": {"command_line": "pip show arcgis"}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content="Command execute_shell_popen returned: Subprocess started with PID:'3664'", type='action_result'), Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "execute_python_code", "args": {"code": "#!/usr/bin/env python\\n\\nimport sys\\n\\n# Add the path to the \'arcgis\' module\\nsys.path.append(\'/usr/local/lib/python3.9/site-packages\')\\n\\nfrom arcgis.gis import GIS\\nfrom arcgis.mapping import WebMap\\n\\n# Connect to ArcGIS Online\\ngis = GIS(\\"https://www.arcgis.com\\", \\"username\\", \\"password\\")\\n\\n# Create a new web map\\nweb_map = WebMap()\\n\\n# Add a feature layer to the map\\nweb_map.add_layer({\\"type\\": \\"FeatureLayer\\", \\"url\\": \\"https://services.arcgis.com/V6ZHFr6zdgNZuVG0/arcgis/rest/services/USA_Rivers_and_Streams/FeatureServer/0\\"})\\n\\n# Save the web map\\nweb_map.save(item_properties={\\"title\\": \\"River Map\\", \\"snippet\\": \\"A map of rivers in the USA\\"})", "basename": "generate_river_map"}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "execute_shell_popen", "args": {"command_line": "pip install arcgis"}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content="Command execute_shell_popen returned: Subprocess started with PID:'3669'", type='action_result')]
"""
